Class
Description
ActionBar
 
Bar
 
Button
 
Constants
 
Constants.Direction
 
Constants.Enemies
 
Constants.Projectiles
 
Constants.Tiles
 
Constants.Units
 
Editing
 
Enemy
 
EnemyManager
 
Flag
 
Game
The main class of the project responsible for creating a new instance of the game.
GameOver
 
GameScene
 
GameScreen
A set of methods related to creating, interacting, and drawing to the game screen.
GameStates
Enumerates all possible game states which is used for detecting game logic, rendering, user interface, and other objects related to that game state.
KeyboardInput
Listens for keyboard input and runs the appropriate function related to the input.
Used for listening when the player presses ESCAPE when playing which removes the currently displayed or selected unit.
LoadSave
This class is responsible for handling external game resources such as reading and writing level files to the system, and loading in images for the game's icon, background and asset sprites.
MathFunctions
This class is responsible for handling mathematical operations such as calculating the distance of two objects for range calculations and for converting the dimensions of arrays when reading and writing level files.
Menu
 
MouseInput
Listens for mouse movement and input and runs the appropriate function related to the input.
Used for listening for LMB when clicking on buttons, clicking on units when playing, and clicking on tiles when editing.
Used for listening to mouse movement and detecting which unit or tile to select based on the current position of the mouse.
Playing
 
Projectile
A projectile is a superclass that interacts with any enemy to reduce their health and apply enemy effects.
A projectile is created from a unit when it is off cooldown and when an enemy is within range.
ProjectileManager
Facilitates the rendering, adding, and removing of projectiles in the playing field.
Render
Calls the appropriate render method of the current scene based on the current game state.
SceneMethods
Defines a default set of methods that are required to be implemented by all subclasses inheriting game scenes.
Settings
 
SlimeBlue
 
SlimeGreen
 
SlimePurple
 
SlimeRed
 
SlimeWhite
 
Tile
A tile is a superclass that represents the grid system of the game and interacts with game logic such as if a unit is able to be placed or if an enemy can pathfind to the set location.
A tile in a location can be edited using the game's built-in level editor or by using pre-defined level files.
TileManager
 
ToolBar
 
Unit
A unit is a superclass that interacts with any enemy to prevent it from reaching the end of the level.
UnitManager
Facilitates the rendering, targeting, placing, deleting and other methods related to interacting with units.
Wave
A wave is an integer array list whose elements are the enemy types.
Waves are constructed in the WaveManager and are used for spawning defined enemy types in short intervals when a new wave is started in the game.
WaveManager
Facilitates the spawning of waves or groups of enemies in set intervals.
